question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: Donald Trump Jr. is a prominent figure within the Republican Party due to his association with his father, former President Donald Trump. However, as of October 2023, there is no public indication that he intends to run for the Republican nomination in the 2024 US Presidential Election. The Republican field already includes strong contenders such as former President Donald Trump himself and Governor Ron DeSantis, who have significant support bases and substantial campaign infrastructure. Additionally, Donald Trump Jr.'s primary role has been as a political operative and commentator rather than as a candidate seeking office. Without a formal campaign declaration, policy positions, or significant movement within the party to support his candidacy, the likelihood of him securing the nomination is minimal.

question.title: Will both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson be selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: In the context of the U.S. presidential election, each major political party, including the Republican Party, typically nominates only one presidential candidate during their national convention. The nomination process involves selecting a single individual to represent the party in the general election. Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson are both prominent figures within the Republican Party; however, it is highly unlikely that the Republican National Convention would select both as presidential nominees simultaneously. The party's structure and electoral strategy support nominating a single candidate to consolidate support and resources. Therefore, the probability that both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson will be selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election is effectively zero.

Asa Hutchinson, the former Governor of Arkansas, has maintained a relatively low profile in national politics since leaving office and has not indicated any plans to seek the Republican nomination. The Republican field for 2024 includes prominent figures such as Donald Trump, Ron DeSantis, and others who have strong support bases and significant political momentum. Given the lack of public campaigning or official announcements from Trump Jr. and Hutchinson, coupled with the presence of more prominent candidates, it is highly unlikely that either of them will secure the Republican nomination.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, President Joe Biden has not signaled any intention to decline seeking re-election for the Democratic nomination in 2024. Historically, incumbent presidents often run for a second term unless there are significant personal, political, or external factors influencing their decision. Biden has remained publicly active and engaged in his presidential duties without any definitive statements indicating he plans to step aside. Additionally, there hasn't been substantial speculation or credible reports suggesting an imminent announcement to that effect. Given these considerations, it is unlikely that Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination.

question.body:

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, AND will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves No otherwise.

This question will resolve as Yes if both (1) and (2) resolve as Yes.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, President Joe Biden has not indicated any intention to decline the Democratic nomination for the 2024 Presidential election. Historically, incumbent presidents seeking re-election typically do not make such announcements prematurely, and there have been no significant indications from Biden or his campaign suggesting a withdrawal. Therefore, the likelihood of Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination is low.

Regarding Kamala Harris, her odds of winning according to Nate Silver's model would depend on various factors such as polling data, campaign developments, and political dynamics leading up to August 9, 2024. Without specific insider information or updates beyond October 2023, it's challenging to accurately predict changes in her Electoral College probability. However, given that the overall demand for Democratic unity and the incumbent president's campaign can influence her chances, any significant increase in her odds within a single week would likely require unexpected positive developments.

Since both conditions need to be met for the overall question to resolve as Yes, and the first condition is highly unlikely, the combined probability remains very low.

question.body: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Joe Biden is alive and actively serving as the President of the United States. There have been no credible reports or indications suggesting any imminent health concerns that would lead to an official announcement of his death before July 26th, 2024. Predicting the death of a specific individual, especially a public figure, is highly speculative and not based on factual information. Therefore, the likelihood of such an event occurring within the specified timeframe is extremely low.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, Joe Biden is serving as the President of the United States. There are no public indications or credible reports suggesting that he plans to resign, face health issues that would prevent him from completing his term, or encounter any circumstances that would lead to him ceasing to be President before the end of July 2024. Additionally, the political environment remains stable without significant controversies that might jeopardize his position. While unforeseen events can always occur, based on the current information available, it is highly likely that Biden will remain President through the specified date.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if either condition is not met. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution of condition (b).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Joe Biden is the sitting U.S. President and, considering his age and health status, the probability of his death before July 26, 2024, is relatively low. Additionally, the U.S. Constitution ensures continuity of leadership through the 25th Amendment, meaning that if President Biden were to pass away, the Vice President would assume the presidency, thereby fulfilling the condition that he remains President through the end of July 2024. However, while the succession process is established, the simultaneous occurrence of Biden’s death and the seamless continuation of his presidency carries a very low probability.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This includes if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Joe Biden is actively serving as the President of the United States and there have been no public indications or credible reports suggesting imminent health issues or intentions to resign. While the possibility of unforeseen events cannot be entirely ruled out, such occurrences are statistically rare for sitting presidents within a relatively short timeframe. Historical data on presidential tenure and health suggests that the likelihood of either the death of a sitting president or their departure from office within a specific period, absent extraordinary circumstances, remains low.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there has been no legal precedent for removing a major party candidate from primary election ballots under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. While there has been public discourse and some legal challenges regarding Donald Trump's eligibility related to the events of January 6, 2021, these have not resulted in official removals or blocks from primary ballots. Implementing such a removal would require significant legal action and consensus across multiple state jurisdictions, which is unprecedented and highly unlikely within the given timeframe. Additionally, political dynamics and Trump's strong influence within the Republican Party make such an outcome improbable without substantial legal breakthroughs, which have not been indicated up to the cutoff date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and not through speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that on July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves negatively.

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as "No". The question solely determines by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

metadata.chain_of_thought: For both events (a) and (b) to occur, there would need to be significant legal and political developments by July 15, 2024. (a) Removal Under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment: Section 3 of the 14th Amendment disqualifies individuals from holding federal office if they have engaged in insurrection or rebellion against the United States. As of October 2023, there have been no official actions or credible legal proceedings removing Donald Trump from primary ballots under this provision. Initiating such a process would require substantial legal groundwork, evidence, and likely result in lengthy court battles, making it uncertain whether this could be achieved by the specified date. (b) Becoming the Republican Nominee: Donald Trump remains a prominent figure within the Republican Party and has significant support among its base. Unless barred from the ballot or withdrawn voluntarily, he has a considerable chance of securing the nomination. However, if event (a) were to occur, it would likely prevent him from being the nominee, as he would be disqualified from holding federal office. Given the mutual exclusivity of these events (if one occurs, the other is highly unlikely) and the current political and legal landscape, the probability that both events will occur by July 15, 2024, is very low.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Donald Trump remains a highly influential figure within the Republican Party, and there is significant support for his potential candidacy in the 2024 US Presidential Election. Historically, he has demonstrated strong capabilities in securing his party's nomination when he chooses to run. On the other hand, the application of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment to remove or block him from the primary ballot would require substantial legal and political hurdles, making it less likely within the given timeframe. Given the high probability of Trump securing the Republican nomination and the relatively lower likelihood of a successful removal under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, it is very probable that at least one of the specified conditions will be met.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of the latest information available up to October 2023, Vice President Kamala Harris is serving under President Joe Biden. The U.S. Constitution stipulates that the Vice President can only assume the presidency if the President is unable to perform their duties due to death, resignation, removal, or incapacitation. There have been no credible reports or indications of such events occurring that would necessitate Vice President Harris stepping into the role of President or Acting President before July 26, 2024. Additionally, there are no political or health-related signals suggesting an imminent change in the presidency. Therefore, the likelihood of Kamala Harris being formally designated as President or Acting President by the specified date is extremely low.

Historically, such simultaneous events are rare and would likely be the result of unforeseen circumstances. Given the current political climate and the stability typically associated with presidential administrations, the likelihood of both events happening within the specified period is low.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there have been discussions and some legal actions aimed at disqualifying Donald Trump from running for federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, which prohibits individuals who have engaged in insurrection or rebellion against the United States from holding public office. However, there is currently no precedent for applying this section to remove a candidate from a primary election ballot. Legal processes to enforce such a removal would likely face significant constitutional challenges, lengthy litigation, and require definitive judicial rulings, none of which have materialized by 2023. Additionally, state election laws and the autonomy of state election boards play a crucial role in ballot access, and there has been no substantial movement or official state government announcements indicating that Trump has been or will be removed from any primary ballots by July 15, 2024. Given these factors, it appears unlikely that Trump will be officially removed or blocked from any state primary election ballot under the specified grounds by the given date.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The United States Olympic Team has consistently demonstrated strong performances in previous Olympic Games, often leading in both total and Gold medal counts. Historically, the USA excels in a wide range of sports, including athletics, swimming, basketball, and gymnastics, where they have deep talent pools and robust training programs. Leading up to the Paris 2024 Olympics, U.S. athletes have shown impressive performances in qualifying events and world championships, indicating high preparedness and competitiveness. Additionally, the support infrastructure, including funding, coaching, and sports science, provides the U.S. team with significant advantages. While international competition remains fierce and unexpected challenges can arise, the combination of historical success, current athlete form, and strong organizational support suggests a high likelihood that the USA will secure more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

metadata.chain_of_thought: The United States has historically dominated the Olympic Medal Tables, consistently ranking at or near the top in both Summer and Winter Games. Factors contributing to this strong performance include a large and diverse pool of athletes, significant investment in sports infrastructure and training programs, and a broad participation across a wide range of sports where the US traditionally excels, such as athletics, swimming, and basketball. Additionally, hosting the Olympics in Paris might provide a slight advantage due to favorable conditions and familiar environments, although this is less pronounced compared to host advantages in other aspects. However, competition from other strong sporting nations like China, Russia, and host nation France could pose challenges. Considering these factors, it is likely that the United States will top the medal table at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals won, followed by Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals in case of ties. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
Reasoning: Historically, the United States has been a dominant force in the Olympic Games, consistently securing a high number of gold medals across a variety of sports, including athletics, swimming, and gymnastics. In the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, which took place in 2021 due to the pandemic, the USA led the medal table with 39 golds out of a total of 113 medals. This trend of strong performance is likely to continue into the 2024 Paris Olympics, given the country's robust athletic programs, funding, and preparation.

Moreover, the USA has shown versatility and depth in its athletic teams, allowing it to perform well across both traditional and emerging Olympic sports. The country's emphasis on sports science and athlete development further enhances its competitiveness. While other nations, notably China, have been closing the gap in recent years, the USA's broad medal prospects make it probable that it will secure more gold medals than silver.

In terms of topping the Olympic Medal Table, the USA has frequently held this position in recent Games. Unless there are significant shifts in global athletic performance or unforeseen circumstances affecting the Games, it is reasonable to expect the USA to maintain its leading position in the medal standings.

question.body:
(a) This resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

(b) This resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. 1. Number of Gold Medals

Given the depth and breadth of the U.S. Olympic team across a wide range of sports, it is highly likely that the USA will either win more gold than silver medals or remain the highest-ranked team in the medal table at the Paris 2024 Olympics. question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The provided context indicates that there is internal opposition among House Democrats regarding the Democratic National Committee's (DNC) plan to secure President Joe Biden's nomination early. Representatives like Jared Huffman are actively circulating a letter to gather signatures from fellow Democrats who are unsettled by the early nomination strategy. Given that the threshold is 20 signatures, and considering the total number of Democrats in both the House and Senate, it is plausible that sufficient opposition exists to meet this threshold. Additionally, public letters can serve as strategic tools to signal dissent and mobilize support. While the DNC may have significant influence, the presence of organized opposition suggests that achieving at least 20 signatures is achievable.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Indian National Congress (INC) has historically been one of India's major political parties, but in recent years, it has struggled to maintain its previous levels of influence and voter base. As of 2023, the INC remains the principal opposition party but faces significant challenges in mounting an effective campaign against the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), which has established a strong organizational presence and widespread support across various regions. Additionally, the political landscape in India is highly fragmented, with numerous regional parties holding substantial sway in their respective states. For the INC to form the government, it would likely need to forge alliances with several of these regional entities, which may be difficult due to differing agendas and priorities. Furthermore, public sentiment has largely favored the BJP in recent elections, and there has been limited momentum for a major shift towards the INC. While it's not impossible for the INC to capitalize on any unforeseen political developments or public dissatisfaction with the current government, the probability remains relatively low based on current trends and historical performance.

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has been a dominant force in Indian politics, securing majority victories in both the 2014 and 2019 general elections. As of October 2023, the BJP continues to hold significant influence both nationally and within various state governments. The party's strong organizational structure, effective campaigning strategies, and substantial support base contribute to its likelihood of forming the government again in the upcoming 2024 general elections.

However, several factors could influence the election outcome. Additionally, regional dynamics and emerging political movements could sway voter preferences. While the BJP remains a formidable contender, the evolving political landscape means there are variables that could impact their chances of securing another majority.

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, both Ron DeSantis and Ted Cruz are prominent figures within the Republican Party with significant support bases. Ron DeSantis, serving as the Governor of Florida, has gained national attention for his policies and leadership, positioning himself as a strong contender for the Republican nomination. Ted Cruz, a Senator from Texas, has previously run for president and maintains a dedicated following within the party. However, other influential Republicans, including former President Donald Trump, continue to play a significant role in the party's dynamics and could impact the nomination process. Additionally, the evolving political landscape and potential emergence of new candidates could influence the outcome. Considering these factors, there is a moderate likelihood that either Ted Cruz or Ron DeSantis will secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.chain_of_thought: Winning an Olympic medal is a significant achievement that typically requires a combination of factors, including strong athletic programs, sufficient funding, and established training infrastructures. Historically, new countries winning their first Olympic medals do occur, but doing so in large numbers within a single Games is uncommon. In recent Olympics, we've seen occasional new medal-winning nations, but reaching a threshold of five in one edition would indicate a substantial shift in global sports development and investment. Factors that could influence this outcome include increased global participation, targeted development programs by emerging nations, and possibly the introduction of new sports where these countries may have competitive advantages. However, given the competitive nature of the Olympics and the dominance of traditionally strong sporting nations, the likelihood of five countries securing their first-ever medals in the 2024 Paris Games remains relatively low.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Historically, the Olympic Games have seen several countries winning their first-ever gold medals, especially in sports where emerging nations have developed competitive programs. In recent editions, we've observed a trend of increased diversity in medal-winning nations due to the globalization of sports training and investment. The 2024 Paris Olympics will feature a wide range of events, some of which may be new or have evolving competitive landscapes, providing opportunities for countries to secure their inaugural golds. Additionally, the host nation often benefits from heightened investment and preparation, which can contribute to medal wins. Considering these factors, it is reasonable to expect that at least five countries may achieve their debut Olympic gold in 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal and (b) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met at the Paris Olympics: (1) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal and (2) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.chain_of_thought: The likelihood of at least 5 countries winning their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics is high, considering the increasing global participation and investment in sports development programs worldwide. Over recent Olympics, there has been a trend of emerging nations securing their inaugural medals across various disciplines. Additionally, winning a gold medal poses a higher challenge due to the increased competition and the level of excellence required. However, as more countries develop their athletic programs and gain experience on the international stage, it's plausible that at least 5 nations could achieve their first-ever Olympic gold. Historical data supports the emergence of new medal-winning countries, and the continued globalization of sports enhances the probability of these milestones being reached in 2024.

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win either their first Olympic medal or their debut gold medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least 5 countries win either their first-ever Olympic medal or their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Olympic Games are continually expanding, with more nations participating and investing in diverse sports disciplines. In recent editions, several countries have achieved their first-ever Olympic medals or their inaugural golds, driven by factors such as improved athletic programs, increased funding, and the emergence of talent in previously underrepresented regions. The introduction of new sports and events also provides opportunities for countries to excel in areas where they traditionally haven't competed. Given the global trend towards greater inclusivity and competitiveness, it is highly likely that at least 5 countries will secure either their first Olympic medal or their first gold medal at the 2024 Paris Games.

question.body:

Additionally, public dissatisfaction would need to reach an unusually high level to motivate multiple Senators to take such a stance openly. Unless there have been major unforeseen developments after October 2023 that dramatically shift the political landscape, it is unlikely that 10 or more Democratic Senators will publicly call for President Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Latvia has a mixed track record in the Eurovision Song Contest. Historically, Latvia has qualified for the Grand Final several times since last participating in 2004, with their best result being a victory in 2002. In recent years, Latvia's performance has been inconsistent, occasionally failing to qualify for the Grand Final. The qualification process depends on various factors, including the quality of the entry, staging, song appeal, and competition from other participating countries. As Eurovision is highly competitive, with numerous talented acts each year, predicting qualification is inherently uncertain. Additionally, without specific information about Latvia's selected entry for 2024, it's challenging to assess their chances accurately. Considering these factors, a balanced probability that reflects Latvia's historical performance and the competitive nature of Eurovision seems appropriate.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the European Union, although certain countries may have experienced temporary restrictions or limitations. The EU has been actively working on regulations related to artificial intelligence, data privacy, and compliance with GDPR, which could influence the availability of AI services like ChatGPT. However, OpenAI has demonstrated a commitment to ensuring broad accessibility of its services globally and has been proactive in addressing regulatory requirements. Given the timeline, with June 30, 2024, providing ample time for OpenAI to navigate any potential regulatory hurdles, it is highly likely that ChatGPT will remain generally available in the EU by that date. Even if minor restrictions persist in specific regions, the definition of 'generally available' allows for over 50% of the population to access the service without significant barriers.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the information provided, two Democratic House Members have already publicly urged President Biden to step down, and two of the most endangered Democrats have expressed doubts about his reelection prospects. Additionally, there are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats, as reported by five individuals familiar with the efforts. However, the key criterion for resolving YES is that at least five named Democratic US House Members or US Senators must collectively pressure Biden to drop out by July 20th. As of now, only two members have publicly made such statements, and the drafts of letters do not yet constitute a confirmed group of five named individuals acting together. Without additional public endorsements from more members meeting the specified criteria, it is unlikely that the market will resolve to YES by the deadline.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, President Joe Biden has not indicated any intention to decline a second term. Incumbent presidents typically seek reelection unless influenced by significant factors such as health concerns, political pressure, or personal reasons. While Biden's age is a consideration, and the political landscape can change, there has been no definitive public statement or credible indication that he plans to announce his decision not to seek the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024. Historical patterns and current indications suggest that it is unlikely he will make such an announcement within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th AND will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message, and their names must be made public before the end date.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

If both of these criteria are met within their respective time frames, this question resolves YES. If either or both are not met, it resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Joe Biden has indicated his intention to seek re-election in 2024. Historically, incumbent presidents who decide to run again generally do so without significant internal party pressure to withdraw, especially when they are the established nominee of their party. For a group of at least five named Democratic House Members or Senators to publicly pressure Biden to drop out would require a substantial shift in the party dynamics and a strong consensus for an alternative candidate. Additionally, making a definitive public announcement by July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the nomination would be a significant and unprecedented move, likely influenced by unforeseen circumstances.

Given Biden's established position and the typical support structure within the Democratic Party for an incumbent president seeking re-election, the likelihood of both conditions being met—significant internal pressure leading to a public withdrawal announcement within the specified time frames—is low.

question.body:
(a) Will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, President Joe Biden had not officially announced whether he would seek re-election in 2024. Historically, incumbent presidents who seek re-election typically receive broad support within their party, making it less likely for a group of at least five named Democratic House Members or Senators to publicly pressure him to drop out. Considering these factors, the probability that either a group of Democratic legislators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th or that Biden will announce he won't seek the Democratic nomination before July 15th is relatively low.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Chasiv Yar has been under Russian control since mid-2022. The town holds strategic significance in the Donetsk region, serving as a key transportation hub and a gateway for further advances into Ukrainian territory. Efforts to reclaim Chasiv Yar by Ukrainian forces would require substantial military resources and sustained offensive operations. While Ukrainian counteroffensives have made some progress in the broader region, dislodging entrenched Russian forces from a town of this strategic importance is challenging. Additionally, Russia has demonstrated a commitment to maintaining control over key positions to bolster its defensive lines. Considering these factors, it is likely that Russia will continue to control Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, barring any significant shifts in the conflict dynamics or unforeseen strategic developments.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that both (a) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, we'll assess each event separately and then consider their joint probability.

**Event (a): Russia's Control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024**
Chasiv Yar is a strategic location in the Donetsk Oblast of Ukraine. As of October 2023, the conflict between Russia and Ukraine has seen fluctuating territorial control. The likelihood of Russia maintaining or extending control over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, depends on several factors:
- **Military Capability and Strategy:** Russia's military operations have faced significant resistance and logistical challenges. Sustained control over contested areas like Chasiv Yar requires substantial resources and strategic advantage.
- **Ukrainian Counteroffensives:** Ukraine has been actively working to reclaim territories, and successful counteroffensives could reduce the probability of Russian control.
- **International Support:** Continued support from Western allies to Ukraine could bolster Ukrainian efforts to counter Russian advances.
Considering these factors, while Russia may retain influence in certain regions, the probability of them securing and maintaining control over Chasiv Yar by the specified date is estimated to be moderate.

**Event (b): Joe Biden Announces He Will Not Accept Democratic Nomination by July 15, 2024**
As of October 2023, Joe Biden is serving his term as President of the United States. Several considerations influence the likelihood of him deciding not to seek re-election:
- **Age and Health:** Biden's age (he was born in 1942) and health are often cited in discussions about his potential retirement, but as of the latest information, there are no definitive public statements indicating his intention to step down.
- **Political Landscape:** The political dynamics within the Democratic Party and his administration's performance could influence his decision. If he perceives strong support within his party, he may be more inclined to run.
- **Personal Preference:** Ultimately, personal considerations will play a significant role, and unless Biden makes a clear indication, it's speculative to assign a high probability to his withdrawal.
Given the lack of definitive statements and ongoing roles, the probability of Biden announcing he will not accept the nomination by the specified date is relatively low.

**Joint Probability:**
Assuming the two events are independent, the joint probability is the product of the individual probabilities.
- Probability of (a) ≈ 0.3
- Probability of (b) ≈ 0.2
Joint Probability = 0.3 * 0.2 = 0.06

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

metadata.chain_of_thought: The projections for "Deadpool x Wolverine" estimating a global opening weekend of $340 million to $360 million significantly exceed the current record for R-rated movies, held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million. Several factors support a high likelihood of surpassing this record: the strong fan bases of both Deadpool and Wolverine, the popularity of Ryan Reynolds, and the reputation of director Shawn Levy. Additionally, the film is expected to play in more theaters, which can contribute to higher box office numbers. Historical data shows that successful R-rated films can achieve substantial openings, and the combined appeal of this crossover might drive even greater interest. However, uncertainties such as competition from other releases, marketing effectiveness, and actual audience reception could impact the final outcome. Given the strong projections and favorable conditions, there is a high probability that "Deadpool x Wolverine" will set a new record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
Reasoning: The relationship between Israel and Iran has been characterized by significant tension and hostility for decades, primarily due to Iran's nuclear ambitions and its support for groups opposed to Israel. Israel perceives a direct threat from Iran's potential to develop nuclear weapons and has historically employed covert operations to counteract Iran's influence and capabilities. While Israel has not engaged in open military conflict with Iran since the 1980s, the landscape remains volatile with periodic escalations and proxy confrontations in the region.

Several factors influence the likelihood of a direct attack by Israel on Iran before May 1, 2024:

1. **Nuclear Developments:** Progress or setbacks in Iran's nuclear program can impact the urgency Israel feels to act. Accelerated progress might increase the perceived need for preemptive action, while diplomatic breakthroughs could reduce immediate threats.

2. **International Relations:** The stance of global powers, including the United States, European nations, and regional players like Saudi Arabia, can either deter or indirectly support such an action. Strong international condemnation could act as a deterrent.

3. **Internal Politics:** Both Israeli and Iranian internal politics play a role. Leadership changes, public opinion, and political stability can influence decision-making related to military actions.

4. **Military Capability and Readiness:** Israel maintains a highly capable and technologically advanced military. However, launching a significant offensive against Iran would require careful planning to avoid extensive retaliation and collateral damage.

5. **Economic and Human Costs:** The potential economic repercussions and loss of life from a direct attack would be substantial, influencing the decision-making calculus.

Considering these factors, while the underlying tensions remain high and the possibility of covert operations exists, the likelihood of Israel conducting a large-scale deadly attack on Iranian soil within the specified timeframe is relatively low. The potential consequences of such an action are significant enough to make it a last-resort option, reserved for scenarios where all other avenues have failed or when an imminent and irremediable threat is perceived.

metadata.chain_of_thought:

   - **Current Standing:** As of October 2023, Vivek Ramaswamy is one of several candidates vying for the Republican nomination. While he has gained attention for his business background and outsider status, the Republican field is competitive with established politicians also in the race.
   - **Prospects:** His chances depend on various factors including campaign effectiveness, fundraising, public appeal, and ability to differentiate himself from other candidates. Polling data would provide more insight, but assuming he maintains a competitive position, there is a moderate probability he could secure the nomination.

2. **Rishi Sunak Failing to be Elected:**
   - **Current Standing:** Rishi Sunak, as of October 2023, is a prominent figure in UK politics, serving as the Chancellor of the Exchequer. His electoral success depends on the performance of his party, public perception of his policies, and the political climate leading up to the July 4, 2024 general election.
   - **Prospects:** Incumbent politicians generally have an advantage, but factors such as economic conditions, party popularity, and opposition strength can influence the outcome. Without specific polling data, it's reasonable to assign a moderate probability to his failure to be elected.

3. **Joint Probability:**
   - Assuming independence between the two events (which may not fully capture any cross-influences but serves as a simplification), the joint probability is the product of the individual probabilities.
   - If we estimate a 30% chance for Ramaswamy to secure the nomination and a 40% chance for Sunak to fail in the election, the joint probability would be 0.3 * 0.4 = 0.12.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that either Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, we need to assess each event individually and then combine their probabilities.

1. **Vivek Ramaswamy as Republican Nominee**:
   - **Current Standing**: Ramaswamy has emerged as a notable contender in the Republican primary race. However, the Republican field is competitive, with established figures like Donald Trump and Ron DeSantis also vying for the nomination.

   - **Polling and Support**: As of the latest data up to October 2023, Ramaswamy has a respectable but not dominant polling position. Unless he gains substantial momentum or the leading candidates face unforeseen obstacles, his chances remain moderate.

2. **Rishi Sunak Failing to be Elected**:
   - **Current Position**: Rishi Sunak is the incumbent Prime Minister and leader of the Conservative Party in the UK. Incumbents generally have an advantage in elections due to name recognition and established political machinery.
   - **Political Climate**: Assuming no major political upheavals or scandals leading up to the July 2024 UK General Election, Sunak's chances of retaining his seat are strong.
   - **Voter Loyalty**: The Conservative Party has a solid voter base, and unless there is a significant shift in public opinion or a surge from opposition parties, Sunak is likely to secure his seat.

**Combining the Probabilities**:
- The probability of either event occurring is the sum of their individual probabilities minus the probability of both occurring simultaneously. Given that these events are relatively independent, the combined probability is slightly less than the sum of their individual probabilities.
- Estimating conservatively:
  - Probability of Ramaswamy becoming the nominee: ~10%
  - Probability of Sunak failing to be elected: ~5%
  - Combined probability: ~10% + ~5% = ~15%

Imposing new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicle imports could disrupt the EU's green initiatives and potentially lead to retaliation from China, which might affect other sectors. Additionally, there hasn't been significant indication or credible reports from reliable sources suggesting that the EU plans to introduce such tariffs in the near future. Given the current focus on collaboration in green technologies and the absence of strong trade tensions between the EU and China in the EV sector, it seems unlikely that the EU will announce new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The current political landscape shows signs of dissent within the Democratic Party regarding Joe Biden's re-election campaign. With two safe-seat members and two of the most endangered Democrats publicly expressing doubts about Biden's chances, there is growing pressure. Additionally, behind-the-scenes activities, such as multiple drafts of letters and reports from five sources about efforts to collectively urge Biden to end his campaign, indicate organizational momentum. However, the resolution specifically requires at least five named Democratic House Members or US Senators to act together in a public and coordinated manner by July 20th. Achieving this level of consensus and public declaration within the given timeframe is challenging, especially considering the strategic considerations and potential repercussions for the members involved. While there is significant groundwork being laid, the formalization and public endorsement by five named individuals remains uncertain.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as collectively speaking with Biden. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before July 20th. Ambiguous cases will resolve NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that both events (a) and (b) occur before their respective deadlines, we need to assess each event individually and then consider their joint likelihood.

**Event (a): The EU announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.**
As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, the European Union has been actively working on reducing dependency on Chinese electric vehicles by promoting local manufacturing and alternative sources. However, instituting new tariffs specifically targeting Chinese electric vehicles within a short timeframe may face significant political and economic hurdles, including negotiations with China and potential retaliation. While it's plausible given ongoing trade tensions, implementing such tariffs by July 5, 2024, would require swift action and consensus within the EU, making this moderately likely but not certain.

**Event (b): A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024.**
Historically, it's uncommon for significant numbers of members from the incumbent president's own party to publicly urge the president to drop out of a re-election race, especially before the midterm elections. Such an action would indicate substantial internal party conflict or serious concerns about Biden's viability as a candidate, neither of which have been prominently evident up to October 2023. Additionally, mobilizing at least five named members to take this stance publicly within the given timeframe is unlikely unless unforeseen circumstances arise.

Considering both events require specific political actions that are individually challenging and, when combined, even less probable, the likelihood of both occurring before their respective deadlines is quite low.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

Additionally, there haven't been significant changes announced regarding the competition format that would disadvantage Greece's chances. Unless there are unforeseen issues with the selected entry or major shifts in the competitive landscape, it is likely that Greece will successfully qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, predicting specific polling numbers for July 15, 2024, involves significant uncertainty due to numerous factors that can influence voter sentiment, such as political developments, campaign dynamics, and unforeseen events. Historically, polling averages like those from FiveThirtyEight tend to stabilize closer to the election date as more data becomes available. Given that it's over nine months away from the resolution date, it's challenging to ascertain whether Trump's lead over Biden would specifically fall between greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points. Additionally, electoral dynamics can shift substantially over time, making such a precise estimate unreliable. Considering these uncertainties, it's relatively unlikely that Trump's lead will be within that narrow range at that specific time.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of July 1, 2024, there has been no public indication from President Joe Biden or his campaign suggesting that he intends to withdraw from seeking the Democratic Party's nomination for the 2024 presidential election. Historically, incumbent presidents often announce their re-election campaigns well in advance of the primary season to secure party support and momentum. Additionally, making such a significant decision as not to run typically involves an announcement made earlier than just two weeks before the nomination deadline to allow sufficient time for the party and voters to adjust accordingly. Unless unforeseen circumstances arise between July 1 and July 15, it is unlikely that Biden would choose to make a definitive announcement against seeking renomination in such a short timeframe.

question.body:
(1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
